summary: This document outlines the procedures for suicide watch and psychology observation for inmates, detailing the conditions, monitoring, and privileges provided. It appears to be a standard correctional facility policy document, not specific to any individual case.
keyFacts: The document defines two inmate statuses: Suicide Watch and Psychology Observation.
Inmates on Suicide Watch are deemed suicidal, placed in special smocks/blankets/slippers, given a paper spoon, and monitored 24/7 by staff or inmate companions.

Inmates on Psychology Observation are not deemed suicidal but may have mental health concerns; they retain uniforms, are given spoons, and may receive approved privileges like toothbrushes or writing materials.
Both statuses require 24-hour monitoring and daily visits from psychology staff.
Legal visits for inmates on Suicide Watch are determined on an individual basis.
